channel.title: StockHedges
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from StockHedges, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: CFPB Calls for Limits, $120 Million Fine Against Navient for Student Loan Practices
item.description: The regulator’s proposed order could permanently ban Navient from servicing federal direct loans.

item.title: These 5 portfolio stocks crushed the volatile market since our August Monthly Meeting
item.description: Investor concerns around the AI boom, coupled with the market's sensitivity to the Fed's next policy move, have caused Wall Street to seesaw in recent...

item.title: The Brawl Taking Shape Over Pfizer's Multibillion-Dollar Heart Monopoly
item.description: The drugmaker’s fastest-growing blockbuster could soon face competition from two biotech firms in the treatment of a little-known heart condition.

item.title: Oracle shares jump 13% on earnings and revenue beat
item.description: While Oracle becomes more competitive in cloud infrastructure, it is also ensuring that competitors can offer its widely used database to their client...

item.title: Falling Interest Rates May Be a Challenge for JPMorgan but Not for Everyone
item.description: Some banks may still see rising net interest income even if the Federal Reserve slashes rates as anticipated.

item.title: Goldman Sachs to post $400 million hit to third-quarter results as it unwinds consumer business
item.description: In late 2022, Goldman Sachs began to pivot away from its consumer operations, beginning a series of write-downs related to selling chunks of the busin...

item.title: Megamerger of European Banks Still Wouldn't Challenge Wall Street
item.description: A potential combination of Italy’s UniCredit with Germany’s Commerzbank would be big, but not big enough to create a European banking champion.

item.title: Why Broadcom stock is tumbling after an earnings beat — and how to play the dip
item.description: The investment thesis for Broadcom is intact: AI revenues are strong, non-AI semi sales are bottoming and the VMWare integration is exceeding all expe...

item.title: Investors Adopt Defensive Crouch Ahead of Fed Rate Cut
item.description: The utilities sector is neck and neck with tech as 2024’s best performing group.

item.title: Broadcom says it will sell $12 billion in AI parts and custom chips this year
item.description: Broadcom CEO Hock Tan said in a statement that the company expects to record $12 billion in sales from AI parts and custom chips in fiscal 2024.
